originalText.text: Onpoint is doing a simply amazing job. They've truly embraced three concepts of harm reduction. They treat they're clients with dignity and respect offer multiple services including acupuncture, acupressure meditation and more. Their supervised consumption site was designed to give their clients a safe place to use while ensuring they come to no harm.

originalText.text: A little chaotic and hectic but they're great folks here offering Amazing services and harm reduction items and a syringe exchange too. I guess it's kinda like a legal shooting gallery? I hear you can even smoke illegal drugs in smoke rooms too, but none of that stuff for me , I'm an old man now ðŸ¤£

Can not say enough about the medical side clinic. It is awesome.Cyn and Dr. Mike are very dedicated to there work
Harlem!

originalText.text: The WELLNESS CENTER, 2nd floor (acupuncture & massage) is excellent. The staff at the front door to NYHRE are a pleasant welcome upon entry and the staff in the wellness center are knowledgeable about holistic care, kind and super friendly. The harm reduction, medical and case management services are good as well.

text.text: The WELLNESS CENTER, 2nd floor (acupuncture & massage) is excellent. The staff at the front door to NYHRE are a pleasant welcome upon entry and the staff in the wellness center are knowledgeable about holistic care, kind and super friendly. The harm reduction, medical and case management services are good as well.

originalText.text: It has taken me quite some time to be able to put into words the kind of environment and care that is being delivered here, at first I was intrigued by the free services they offered like laundry care,shower, food and access to holistic medicine, however after thorough observation everything is not what it seems to be, to start staff speaks in a derogatory manner to clients and belittles them. They should be reminded that they have a job and funding because of the clients they talk down to (mental health and substance abuse disorder clients)Second the facility is said to be a safe haven yet they allow parole social workers on site to observe clients which goes against the policy. Last I have witnessed more attempts in encouraging substance use than offering rehabilitation services or harm reduction including sticking the needle with the drugs directly into a clients vein and administer the substance, yes literally PUSH the drug into the client. Completely unethical and morally wrong. These facilities should be inspected and revamped completely. I am glad I did not get selected as a new hire after observing  what I consider a nightmare of a shadow shift. How can you promote you want to change and save the lives of your community and are just treating them as numbers to get funding. A system that is broken no organization other than entering the clients social security numbers into a data base and charging Medicaid for the services you render like food and tools for their substance abuse. A complete misrepresentation of what true quality care is and should be. Above all the department of mental hygiene should fine this establishment. They do not practice infection control! cross contamination everywhere and services are limited and cut down on a daily basis. Operations close sooner than what is listed on the website.
